content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `find`. It computes median over arbitrary array. Provide an example

Sure, here's how you might define such a function in Julia:

```julia
function find_median(arr::Array)
    sort!(arr)
    length = length(arr)
    if length % 2 == 0 # Even number of elements
        return (arr[length รท 2] + arr[(length รท 2) - 1]) / 2.0
    else # Odd number of elements
        return arr[div(Int64, length รท 2 + 1)]
    end
end
```

You can call this function with any array:

```julia
arr = [3,5,7,9]
println("The median is ", find_median(arr))

arr = [1,2,3,4,5]
println("The median is ", find_median(arr))

arr = rand(10) # Generate an array of 10 random numbers between 0 and 1.
println("The median is ", find_median(arr))
```
This function will sort the input array before finding the median, because the median of a list can't be defined if the list isn't sorted.
